_1-sudJlYwXjtLyPK95_lA.text: Steer clear of the duck taco. No Bueno!

baZa4NfAcZ-QyozRM3C7bw.text: If you are looking for a True change in Mexican food.  You must try CRUjuente tacos. With choices like Green Chile Chicken, Texas Wagyu Cap Steak, Duck and Garlic Roasted Mushrooms. You can find the perfect Taco for your taste.  appetizer Charred Octopus, and Papas Fritas are a great place to start. Dont forget to try the Pasole Rojo one of the stars of this menu.  Margarita for ever taste hand made to order. Save room for the dessert taco tonight it was a blueberry lemon taco. this is a MUST TRY. The service is great and the kitchen is in point

hMIlt3D7mAo3gamx1rvdBQ.text: I went to CRUjiente tacos by myself on a Thursday night because I didn't want to wait for a friend to go with me to try it. I'm a vegetarian and was excited to see that they had two savory taco options for vegetarians. Here is the breakdown of what I ordered: -Garlic Roasted Mushroom Tacos: This taco had a really delicious savory umami flavor. I've never had this type of a taco before so it was interesting to try. -Tempura Avocado Taco: Also really delicious, but more straightforward taco. I'm glad they have this as a second option for vegetarians to help keep it a bit more interesting. But if I'm being totally honest, I feel like I've had this taco before. -Arcadia Margarita: My favorite item of the night. Their margaritas are so fresh tasting and definitely worth a try. I will need to come back for happy hour to drink more margaritas! Their margaritas are definitely some of the best in the valley.  Service was pleasant, but nothing over the top. I do like the general upscale yet trendy casual vibe of the restaurant. I would definitely keep in mind that if you plan to eat here for a meal, you would probably need 3-6 tacos depending on how much you eat. And at $5-8 per taco, you will be spending anywhere from $20-60 just for food+tax+tip for one person. So if you aren't prepared to spend that much, I would recommend going for happy hour and making the tacos more of a snack. Also side note that Yelp says "Latin American" as the type of cuisine, but I would definitely say that it's more "New American + tapas" in case that matters to anybody.

FrA2QtBA0uzEP-JMJoYYhg.text: Best tacos in town!! Can't get enough! Have to eat here at least once a week!!! Crujiente Beef taco is my fave fave fave!!! Fresh fish taco....BOMB!!! Ceviche..... to die for!!!!! Chips and guac....YUM!!! Have to get it all!!! And if you're looking for a bomb michelada!!!!?!!!! This is your Jam!!!!!!!! Get it!! Best one you'll ever have!! Margaritas are top notch!!! Get one of those too!!! The staff is wonderful! Lauren and Rachel are always so sweet, warm, efficient, fast, and love the food as much as I do!!!! CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!!!

E2_S4Rgc3Acy4aW2AEVT6g.text: Great little restaurant...don't let the fact that it's stuck in a strip center fool you...this place has a really cool vibe and the food and drinks are amazing.  I would definitely recommend this place to any and everyone.

FHLghZ9oqBz_gRdLRijnCA.text: Awesome tacos! Try it family style and order 2 of each. They're so amazing and fresh. Great service too. Happy hour is highly recommended

Q19rYjjKpLD-OEzxshbCRQ.text: Delicious tacos! Great vegetarian and gluten free options (avoid the chips and crunchy tacos if Celiac). Had their weekly taco, it was butternut squash. Highly recommend the shrimp taco!  Can't wait to come back!

yq_H-4UmRzdjaOWhswLtag.text: The BEST tacos I have ever had. Perfect cocktails, too. I only wish I didn't live 2,300 miles away.

2lDVE6HeOpMGvN7TFz_q0A.text: These tacos blew my mind! You really can't go wrong with any of them. My favorites were the shrimp, mushroom, and the crunchy lamb tacos! I couldn't stop ordering. Special shout out to the duck and pork belly tacos, and don't pass up dessert! I was on a diet but came here for a special occasion...let's just say that the tacos were 1000% worth the calories. The happy hour specials are amazing too, so there's really no reason NOT to come here!!

mxA-YKqwOgnYaGSWs-6lIg.text: Best Tacos, Drinks and atmosphere in the area. Try the salsa trio, you won't be disappointed

eyjy84xC_6V7bnI9I-zpuA.text: Absolutely no place else to go for your taco fix.  Far and away the best.  Beautiful build out, friendly, efficient staff and, in case I failed to mention, amazing tacos, ceviche, posole, salsa, beer and cocktails.  You will immediately abandon your other "favorite" taco place!

17TapECNeonNgs3OT6GZlg.text: Everyone posts about the fantastic tacos... so I'm gonna post about the amazing spirits! The Cinnamon Margarita and the Cherry Sour are amazing thanks to the creativity of their bar manager Laura! We love this place!

oJmWX7br8ajEIpwh2dWQoA.text: Incredible tacos....don't miss the ceviche,  pork belly, Korean fried chicken  (unreal) and poke. Great service and a cocktail list that will keep you busy! Can come back over and over and have a different and amazing meal each time!

pOTfEu7QD6TSlTwnPIjjFw.text: I have been stopping in once or twice a month now since they have opened. The tacos are absolutely amazing and the staff is always super friendly. I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for great food and a superb atmosphere! 5 stars and make sure you get the crunchy beef taco or the Korean fried chicken taco....so good!!

UTjBcrS7rSMb6ebjY5amOQ.text: Simply astonishing. I came here expecting just another strip mall average to below average taco shop. This place is phenomenal. The crunchy beef taco is off the chart.  Ambience on point as well. Our server was gracious and so talkative.

Y9OhDYFaiHLPQDKEgroGUw.text: Awesome place! Our waitress was amazing and very friendly. The fried beef taco is out of this world. Nice beer selection as well. We will be going back!!

EWt79cuL9pbYCNVqyerUKg.text: Blows Blanco out of the water!  Had the chorizo Queso with warm chips!  Ate every spec out of the cast iron pot. Had the crispy pork taco, Korean fried chicken taco and the blue crab taco. All three were yummy but I will crave that pork taco.....

EZ-VAaResduwcIHnIqc3ZQ.text: We stopped in for dinner last night after reading all of the amazing reviews on Yelp and were not disappointed!  We started with a beer and the Don't Drive and Thrive cocktail (so tasty!) and the queso.  We tried 6 different tacos, so we could sample most of the menu.  Here are the tacos we tried in order of preference: crab, NY Cedar River steak, crispy pork, fish, crispy beef and crispy lamb...honestly, all of them were amazing, so it was hard to even rank what we tasted.  I highly recommend tasting a mix of the regular and crunchy tacos...both are unique and flavorful.

pU4qyYSfv_70kWoOASwykw.text: Great spot: nice ambiance, great service, excellent food. We ordered 6 different types of tacos and loved everyone of them! My favs were the lamb, pork, fish and avocado tempura. Can't wait to come back!

S3By-0T8wc3KlM8TVcni3A.text: Came here on a Tuesday night for the first time.  Although they didn't have any taco Tuesday specials and their tacos were a little pricey for the size, they did not disappoint!  We came in a little after 10 and even though their kitchen normally closes at 10, they were happy to take our food order.  Our server Lauren was really informative, and attentive.  And the tacos were delicious.  Favorite was the Korean fried chicken!  Also tried the grand CRU Margarita!  Yummy!  If I'm in the area and craving tacos, I'm coming back here!

PpHx5gUr18PzyZ-6c4047w.text: Staff is super friendly and tacos are amazing! I'd highly recommend the pork belly taco, ahi poke taco, and the Kaula pork taco (taco of the week). Margaritas are awesome as well! I will be back!

frTgCty-r9eNjYtn4E4KIw.text: Get the 36 hour short rib taco. Authentic style dressing and the meat is phenomenal.  I had to order more. The bar is stacked for whisky and tequila lovers.  Salads need a little pick me up but who goes to a taco joint for salads? Only my wife. Silly goose.

lHSrZRajxkLEWQ_AQlNyCw.text: Amazing beef tacos! The margaritas are good but sometimes are a little pulpy...but at least they are fresh and not from a mix. My only complaint is they are not open for lunch. Service has been friendly and the food is delicious

VDp6G6_HHWXFSxwjYhEDaA.text: Being named one of the best new restaurants in Phoenix area for 2017, I had very high expectations. Tacos were good but not great. They were very small in size and very pricey. Guacamole was very small and flavor was average. My husband and I had guacamole, lamb, avocado, beef short rib, fish, and Texas Wagyu tacos and two margaritas. For the total of the check and we had much, much better meals at many restaurant in the valley. Their concept remanded me a little of a great places in Chicago area called Bien Trucha and A Toda Madre except they will never share their success and endless lines waiting to get in over last ten years. Crujiete Tacos are simply overprices and not that great.

dMs10o9CjK1ia9GbYpKeDQ.text: Ok, nothing to write home about. Restaurant was pretty busy but service @ bar wasn't great.

oVyrqBejiVzSNrItMA_cew.text: The girlfriend and I are always excited when a new taco place opens up because we really, really love tacos. However, Crujiente didn't really do it for us. Here the play by play: Drinks - expensive enough that we didn't get any Queso Fundido - like most of the meal, they went for something outside the traditional. The flavor was decent, with an unusual earthy taste. Unfortunately, the consistency was a bit too oily (and the oil felt a little old) Pork taco - by far the best food item we had. The shell was awesome, and the pork was very well marinated and moist. Everything here was on point.  Lengua Taco - dry, bland meat. I'm usually a lengua lover, but this one did nothing for me. Lamb - The super-sweet Birria sauce overpowered everything else. The flavor would have been pretty good, if they just laid off the sugar a bit. I love mole and don't mind sweet with my meat, but this was too much. Service- attentive, but oddly cold. Atmosphere- dark and swanky  Overall, we likely won't come back. With so many great taco places at pretty much every price point. This one just didn't stick out

WRmqPv0uHSGU9HfUSMSPuA.text: Delicious tiny expensive tacos! My only real complaint is that they do not do to go orders. Great food and service.

yolu6QlgA0o3PKhOtexNpg.text: So this place was fun but a little disappointing unfortunately. My husband and I had he Korean fried chicken, crispy beef, poke, and blue crab tacos. They were tiny!!! I was still hungry after several bags of chips and two tacos. Probably will not be back when there are better priced places in the area.

V5so7XtRxAYi4sMlvsZ_xw.text: Do you like inventive, spicy, delicious food?! get there. Everything was completely delicious, including fun cocktails, homemade chips, suuuuper fresh & good salsa/pico and I loved the guac (my companions were mixed on this one). Can't wait to come back and try it again. Great service, super friendly staff, excellent food!

Qjx1f3pSYKph14gDz_odng.text: The place is trendy and comfortable, service is good; food is very good. Love the avocado tempura tacos!  Friendly staff and the chef nailed the flavors, quality and presentation!  It's so beautiful you want to eat it, the fragrance of the food is so balanced

NfuDX6Rj6XkwosV4gStMKg.text: We love this place!  Great atmosphere, excellent food and drinks and super friendly and knowledgeable staff!  Morgan was working behind the bar both times we've been there and she is great!  We will be back Monday for $5 margaritas.

43NLVLq7VnKO9YWSEHNRSA.text: THIS IS MOST FUN AND EXCITING RESTAURANT I HAVE BEEN TO IN A LONG TIME!   It starts with very great Arcadia Margaritas and Hacienda de Arinzano; and some excellent happy hour wines. THE VARIETY OF MANY DIFFERENT TACOS IS EXCITING! We had Beef Tacos, Pork tacos, Lamb Tacos, Korean Fried Chicken Tacos, Tempura Avacado Tacos (extra special), Beef Short Rib Tacos, Green Chile Chicken Tacos (very special) Pork Chicharron VIP Tacos! (very special), Cruncy Beef Tacos, Ceviche Taco, Taco de la Semana.   AND there were five more I wanted; but, I was too full. Thes many Tacos make a dinner exciting, fun, and very different from your normal Mexican restaurant.   Our waiter was Lauren, who we wore out bring us many, many drinks and many, many, TACOS All Special and Wonderful!!!   It was special surprise to see Jason Morris come to our booth 36 to greet us.  Jason is the owner and Co Founder.   Try this exciting eating experience; and, you will not be disappointed. TIP:  Go early 4 pm to avoid crowds.   The Bar scene is also very exciting.  I talked with several people who love sitting at the Bar!!  sincerely,  Ed Altman,  Jr

vA_JDcUlT5sSQhW9CeEkDg.text: We have dined at Crujiente a handful of times now and it does not disappoint! Service and especially the food are great. Our particular favorites are the Korean fried chicken taco and the crunchy lamb. Their Cru margarita is also delicious. Solid spot for happy hour and such a great addition to the neighborhood!

DIflooAOUHCqonCBiyuEiw.text: This place is an overlooked treasure. We thought we were going to be getting typical Mexican food, but it was anything but that. Instead we found a charming restaurant with nice ambiance, excellent service and a delightful menu. There was a wide selection of craft beers that made us happy but the best part of the evening was the tacos. Whether you felt like fish or steak or chicken, each taco was a culinary delight. Excellent sauces, many varieties and none disappointed. This place is now on our A list.

E-7fAv884B6c1c3QkyvN9g.text: I love this spot it reminds me of the bar/restaurants in NY.  Ordered salsas tacos and drinks and everything was tasty.  Nice hangout, good service and great food!

31sgQ0GeeA3Z_xaIpeok4Q.text: Have been meaning to try this place since it's just down the street, but was hesitant, I have to admit... was totally impressed immediately when we walked in- they put a window in the front! It didn't feel like a dungeon in there, as it did with the previous restaurant.  The bartender immediately greeted us and asked if we had ever been there. He told us all about the menu, was attentive, knowledgeable, great personality and very friendly! I'd sacrifice an average meal for great service alone... However, the food was much greater than average. We ordered quite a few tacos, ceviche, gauc, salsa- it was all so fresh and flavor was amazing.  The chef came out as well as the owner or manager, and spoke to the few of us who were there at the bar. Impressed to say the least! I will be back! Thank you!

2nIiJEda9iqTto9s6G28uQ.text: The BEST tacos, craft cocktails and staff.  I'm blessed to live walking distance and this is a regular spot for me.  They're consistently raising the bar with the Taco of the Week, and getting ready to roll out some surprises!

tHUpGerl41vdU5Gce1U0SQ.text: 3.5 even though regular tacos are excellent.  Service is lacking.  Friendly but understaffed.  No one wants to be thanked for "their patience" when waiting for food.  My food sat in the window (thankfully they don't use heat lamps), so it was room temperature at best. Guacamole took 15 minutes.  DO NOT come here really hungry like I did, or it will test your patience.  Food presentation is very aesthetically appealing, and most of the food tastes as good as it looks.  Also, apparently, even though nothing in the description indicates fried, the CRUjientes tacos are deep fried.  Not delicious at all...and usually fried is.

fA6m0yX-vw19hNXoWo5RHA.text: Omg this place is bomb!!! The cocktails are stupid good. I love the service we always get, and the happy hour is awesome. They accommodated my vegan diet, but the boyfriend is a meat eater and he is always blown away. I love the chips and salsa trio, it's super yummy.

8Nvf_cl9c_ocO-SfObNjAg.text: Always awesome to hear a new taco place is opening up in the area. I'm so glad this place lived up to our expectations. We ordered a smorgasbord so that we could try as many different tacos as possible and they were so good. I would definitely recommend the short rib, the Korean and the crunchy taco. The fish taco was also good. The New York was too sweet for my taste. We also had the queso dip with chips. It has chorizo in it and it was so good.   One thing I definitely hope they change is the fact that they don't do take out. I called to find out if they do and I was told no.. That's a bummer..

Pk7oItkLBSZZhyuQ7PdIMg.text: Hands down best tacos ive ever had... been in three times already  tried almost  every  taco and they are all to die for, if you want your taste buds to start dancing  look no further. Excellent service at the bar from the lovely morgan!!!! P.s the michelada is AWESOME!!!!

IrUtTECo4ovPCfV3eGMhwQ.text: So disappointed!!  After hearing for weeks that this place was opening we were looking forward to trying it.  The service was horrible. I really don't know how else to describe it.   We ordered chips & salsa as an appetizer.  It never came.  We had to ask for it after our dinner was served.  Not one person came to ask how our dinner was. We never even had silverware!  Fortunately we were eating tacos but I still would have preferred a fork or knife.  The worst part is the bill. For $50, 5 small street tacos and chips & salsa, way way overpriced.  Yet and still if the service was better we could have lived with it.  Edit in response to Jason's comment below: Breakdown of bill looked like this: 3 hard tacos - $18 2 small tacos - $10 total  Chips & salsa - $5......btw, never went to Mexican restaurant and had to pay for chips 1 cocktail - $10 1 ice tea  Total: $47.63 Tip: $6.50 Total bill: $54.13

ExE7S3wzH3RroGGpn3ecpg.text: We came for taco Tuesday because the ratings were so high. They offer unique variations of tacos, I'd say they are non traditional. The Korean chicken tacos were great but a bit salty. I would not recommend coming if you are looking for your traditional pollo or carne de Asada tacos. They weren't supper busy around 9pm . The Waitstaff was very welcoming and gave great service!

J1pywn7c7jg1Z7Mh_aA71w.text: This is my favorite local spot.  Love the tacos, the service, the margaritas, and the ambience.  The Korean chicken tacos and the street corn are my favorite dishes but you won't be disappointed to Rg anything.  Wish they were open for lunch too!

F4ZIyHA-LbP01yKbk18KDQ.text: If I could give this restaurant 1,000 stars I would. THIS IS THE BEST FOOD I'VE HAD IN A LONG TIME! From the moment you walk in, you get a sense of a relaxed vibe with the perfect ambiance for a nice dinner with friends. Several booths and large high top tables are great for enjoying the company of friends or family. Now let's get to the important part, the food!! There were so many mouth watering options I couldn't even decide. The owner was very helpful and was very passionate. I could tell he loved his job as hr was describing the flavor notes of each street taco.These street tacos are not messing around. No take out orders to keep the QUALITY of their food fresh. I finally decided on the Waygu and Korean bbq and I am still dreaming about them! My friend ordered Waygu and a shrimp as well as a fish taco and all were delicious. You really can't go wrong but the flavors and the melt in your mouth beef had me craving more and more! And the best part? The prices! For the quality as well as fresh ingredients and homemade salsas it was very affordable. This amazing restaurant needs to be HYPED UP! It is in an unassuming little shop area! You won't be disappointed and the atmosphere and taste of the food is excellent. I have been raving about this establishment ever since and I am so glad I was recommended to go here. OH and I almost forgot, their Queso! It is Tex Mex style with influences from San Antonio and it was to die for! Also, the chips were hot and crisp with the perfect amount of salt. Every aspect of my experience was phenomenal.

HN3UaPzCFZQcAYCVx-Nnxw.text: Last night I had the best everything! Six of us met for happy hour and dinner, 4 for the first time. We got there early, ordered the premier cru margarita, a beer and guacamole and fell in love! Between the six of us we had the Korean fried chicken taco, beef short rib taco, lamb taco, oyster taco, duck taco, pork belly taco, street corn, pozole and gazpacho. We had the margaritas, Spanish red wine and beers.  I am Mexican and like rice and beans with my Mexican food.  Last night I did not miss them.  The food is all perfectly seasoned, a bit hot for one in our group, but otherwise just perfect. Service was excellent from the moment we walked in till we walked out. Chef Hinojosa has created my new favorite Mexican restaurant.  And not just because we are both from Texas where he obviously got his very fine early training.  What a wonderful addition to our Latino restaurants.

eN6Vrr-ZBpdY7OQIBp-npg.text: I kept seeing photos from here on my Instagram feed and have been wanting to go. I finally made it here a few weeks ago for some tacos. I got the ahi, blue crab, and fish tacos since I had a big burger at lunch and wanted to go the seafood route. The ahi taco was by far my favorite... I could have those every week! The blue crab tacos kind of reminded me of a fish stick. The fish taco was really good too. We also got their chips & guac. The chips came in a brown paper bag and were nice and hot (temperature-wise). Note that they are closed on Sundays.

WhANNvhohCmmeCXaPfulTg.text: Stopped by after seeing my favorite paleo chef post on Instagram that she ate here last night and raved about it! Her review did not disappoint!! This place is fabulous and happy hour is daily from 3-6pm!! Lots of gluten free options.  We had the chips and guacamole and queso which were $2 off for happy hour. The pork belly tacos were our favorite! Also $1 off during happy hour. They have some super fun cocktails too. Highly recommend!

gvEqbMXR4WZzYAFMOlsL5A.text: Host was not organized in taking names to seat folks, no place to stand and wait.  Drinks are delicious $10-13, tacos are small, DELICIOUS, and pricey $4.50 - 6.50 a piece.

wObJ5VATCYB9Ylu-YNBrSA.text: Started with Guacamole & Chips, and the best Michelada  that I've ever had. The guac was amazing. Ordered a couple of amazing tacos pork belly and a crispy taco with beef.  Man, I will definitely be back here!!   By the way, the service rocks!

fBlImCfD66s0TtmEb9CU-A.text: Exceptional! From the service to the food! This place DID NOT DISAPPOINT! This will be our new taco Tuesday spot! Pork Belly taco... amazing! Korean Fried taco... magnificent!(the server suggested we save this one for last, thank you Morgan!) CRUjiente pork taco... my favorite! CRUjiente beef taco... great flavor! Cinnamon margarita... holy margarita heaven! Yamakazi single malt whiskey (thank you random helper)... not for the weak! Dessert taco, with carrot cake and goat cheese... bomb! Queso... geez can they do anything wrong? Seriously, pleasantly surprised. It's a must try!  Hold the phone... HAPPY HOUR ALL DAY WEDNESDAY? never mind we're coming back tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OZieFhdtIcNTBM95itBLYw.text: CRUjiente offers some of the tastiest tacos in the valley. Whether you are looking for a more traditional taco, or you are looking for a crunchy Korean Fried Chicken taco, this place has it all.  Special note for you whiskey fans, I spotted a bottle of Yamazaki Single Malt 12 year whiskey behind the bar.  I highly recommend it, as it offers notes of butterscotch and caramel.

z1sgr4UmrhPhVJY73fD_qg.text: Ordered - Tempura Avocado Tacos : too good to stop with just 1. Amazing taste, Good presentation. Desert Taco : chef special. Cheese cake with strawberries. Just mind blowing. Amazing combo and well thought.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar chairs, tempura Avocado tacos and sweetest lady next to me to talk to. Simply the best night!!
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos are great.

7e6YA-6YXn_h-io5nOpZxg.text: I've wanted to try this place so my hubby and I decided why not today.    Parking: horrible, it's a strip mall area so you already know the deal!  Pray that someone is leaving quickly.   Food: WOW.... I'm very hard to impress when it comes to Mexican food but those tacos were a slam dunk! I had the fish tacos... and OMG the fish was grouper! It was seasoned to perfection with not a lot of fluff, just a great piece of grilled fish.   My husband had the Korean tacos.... oh yeah! It was tempura fried chicken that was extra crispy.... oh my I'll have another one or two.   Drinks: the drinks were excellent.  The bartender really takes the time to make you a perfect drink.  There are not frozen from a machine she muttells all of the fresh herbs that go into every drink, so a mojito takes like a refreshing mojito!   Is it worth a return visit: most definitely. The decor was hip and some what romantic but of course the food had me at HELLO!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s Friday!
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s complete
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh yeah

ATQq1LducwE-rv6yo6ae_A.text: Our friends have been trying to get us to try CRUjiente for months and we finally stopped in last week. I am super picky when it comes to tacos and Mexican food in general and this was the best I have had in a very long time. The taco special of the day was crab, which I ordered in addition to the shrimp taco. They were street taco sized but packed a ton of flavor. My husband ordered a pork belly (YES!!!), Korean fried chicken (super tasty), and green chill chicken (YUM!) tacos and loved them all.   Our table ordered the guacamole and trio salsa appetizers, both we loved. The queso was good but nothing exceptional, our friends let us know that it is generally better than it was that night. We also ordered the grilled corn, which I could easily eat my weight in, yum!   We tried a number of specialty cocktails, each more delicious from the last. I look forward to coming back on Wednesdays for all day happy to score deals on the tacos, apps, and cocktails. It is like Taco Tuesday, but even better!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry basil margarita
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted corn and Guacamole
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa trio

uAGM_l42uGxoUUsdJtWKWA.text: I've been coming here consistently for over a year now and it is, hands down, my favorite taco place in Arizona. The quality is always top notch and service is fast and friendly.  My favorites are the Korean Fried Chicken and Pork Belly and be sure to ask about the taco of the week!  All margaritas are great and they have an extensive beer and whiskey list.

I0nwHhUS7mS3FzfdMf2eRA.text: The place looked small from the outside, but the atmosphere and ambiance inside was great! Never judge a book by its cover! The staff was super friendly.   To start, we ordered guacamole and chips. The guacamole was freshly made with the perfect amount of flavor. The three salsas they provided where full of flavor!   I ordered the pork belly (deliciously tender pork), the shrimp (perfectly seared with the right amount so flavor) and the short rib (packed with flavor and so tender) all tacos!  The Japanaknees Bee drink was a great taste of honey infused Toki whiskey margarita! Great place to eat overall!!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Japaneez Bee Margarita
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib taco, shrimp taco and pork belly taco
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole!

_cPh6tTTYyMndQkp6tRtwQ.text: Service was impeccable at the restaurant. The food was great tasting as well. If you go there please get the grilled street corn. Is a must have and tastes delicious. Be warned it's got a kick to it but it's not too spicy.   I ordered lamb taco, shrimp and the Korean chicken. Loved the Korean chicken, and the shrimp as well. The lamb had a great taste to it at first but then later noticed it was super salty. Thankfully it was still bearable.   For drinks I got an old fashioned with bulleit bourbon and that was also good. Will definitely come back .  Thanks to our server for taking good care of our table and always checking upon us.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JshfYTPQoWQ_BnrnVBKKFQ.text: The tacos were so much better than I expected them to be.  This is a new fav, the kind of place I want to bring friends, visiting family, just myself often... I was so impressed at the amazing flavor of every taco we ordered.  The Korean fried chicken, the pork belly, the crunchy pork, the duck, the Wagyu beef, the fried avocado... were alllll amazzzzzing .... The blue corn tortilla,  ohhh man, just beyond amazing... I also had an Arcadia margarita, it was fantastic.    Now knowing the check in process (very confusing for 1st time, as other reviews said, you just get looked at, no hostess, no space, etc)  I know what to expect... It isn't ideal, but it isn't a big deal... It was very cool to see you can check in on Yelp.

Gz983nGEJJZbsT5_FlaByg.text: I loved this place! This was the food highlight of my trip to Arizona. While pricier than your average taco at $5-7 a pop, each one was a unique fusion experience of different flavors. We got mushroom, fish, pork belly, duck, and steak between my friend and I. I have no regrets (except maybe not ordering one more taco...they all sounded so good). Margaritas were also standout- smoky, spicy, bold concoctions that aren't your typical sugary drink. If I'm ever back in the area it will be hard to stay away from this place, especially with all the daily specials (deals on food and drinks) they have!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly, duck, steak tacos (left to right)

h2IQlZg5sDC8ZAYMvj5JOw.text: Went for a Saturday dinner with another couple who had never been to CRUjiente. I called ahead to make a reservation for 4, but was told they don't make reservations for less than 5. Strange policy, but okay.  I recommend securing your time slot online about 20-30 mins prior to when you'd like to dine. My husband went through the online request but it wasn't needed as we were sat right when we walked in. We went in just before 6pm.  We made it in time for HH (ends at 6) and were able to order some discounted drinks and apps. By the way-- the CRU margarita is delicious!  Our group ordered a variety of crunchy and regular tacos and were pretty pleased. The green Chile chicken was a little bland, but the crunchy pork and fish were very good. We took a gamble on their featured dessert taco and it fell a little flat.  Overall, a good dining experience and our friends said they'd try it again. Our waitress was extremely kind and helpful in making recommendations. We'll be back!

LvqxScfP44k8bZum9r4lCA.text: Good vibes, tasty food and fast service, cannot describe this place better. Tried their salsa trio which was delicious! Highly recommend their avacado tempura and the mushroom tacos. Love that they had these vegan options.

2Hd34hXEBQKDQNahoDZAPQ.text: Korean fried chicken! Best tacos I've had here in AZ!! just wish happy hour was a bit better ;)

KNcrNpUuCfVaoRJcj2LtQw.text: Came to this little neighborhood gem for Taco Tuesday with some friends. I would definitely recommend trying different styles of tacos but my favorite was the pork taco dishes. The flavorful was bursting and the pork was moist, tips were crispy, which I absolutely enjoyed! Service was good and the ambiance is low lighting and super comfortable vibe.

Z9plZTtwzMUROHPSe7A2lw.text: Flavorful tacos. Try Korean chicken taco. Remember to use the iPad out front to get on waiting list. Very popular but wait is short.

su-4UjY7JQRW5ytFkgpVlw.text: Very sophisticated and artistic tacos, it's an art gallery you can not only see but also smell, taste, and touch! The tacos really do look like works of art that are both appealing to the eyes and also palate.   We ordered the Duck Breast taco, the Tempura Avocado taco, Green Chile Chicken taco, 36 Hour Beef Short Rib taco, the Pheasant and Potato taco (taco of the week), and the Lamb taco. My absolute favorite was the Duck Breast, it was otherwordly! Tasted surreal. I never liked duck or pickled anything but almost every taco had a pickled vegetable and it went incredibly well with them. I feel converted. My second favorite was the Pheasant and Potato taco. And third favorite was the Green Chile Chicken taco.   The flavors in each taco are completely different from each other which is refereshing, and the flavors within each are a combination of complementary components. Yes, $5 for a taco might seem like a bit much but it's well worth it. You might end up loving a food or meat that you didn't like before, which is saying something.   We also had dessert which were strawberry tortilla tacos with strawberries, cream, and cake.  The bathrooms were neat and had large complementary images on them and the inside was slightly surreal as well as modern. Keeping with the theme of the restaraunt's concept.  Great execution in every aspect!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cute bathroom doors.
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All their awards from the Arizona Taco Festival from 2015 to present
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dessert taco: fresh strawberries, cream, and cake

V6cyvXRI3VIUncEfZYNz6A.text: The Korean fried chicken taco is literally bomb.com! I'd pick this for my last meal good.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean friend chicken taco  and taco de la semana- cauliflower taco.

-vmj-qshGExV5PskoApxMQ.text: Delicious, savory tacos! A perfect combination of flavors. I don't typically eat modern Mexican food but this place did it right and I am glad I tried it out. All my tacos were very well put together and bursting with flavor. Our visit was pleasant and our waitress provided good recommendations. We will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rKrnChWeZDKE0AhLbxfpgg.text: This place was amazing! We had seen it and had it saved in our collection forever and it did not disappoint. I had the taco of the week which was a flounder taco, a beef crunchy taco and a Korean chicken taco. The crunchy taco was amazing in that it did not fall apart, and did not cut your mouth! The flounder taco was so perfect that I could eat 100 of them. I can't wait to come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flounder taco, Korean Fried Chicken Taco, beef taco

85WnreA6lDuUVfohb6DLgw.text: We went for taco Tuesday. My bf and i are vegan so they made veggie tacos with out cheese. They were really tasty but for a small street taco that's $4.50 is a little much.

wuYLZ6CvHrCfJrStc_OWMw.text: Fantastic service (Nora, manager and bartender- great job).  Knowledgeable staff, great bartender, and food is beautifully presented and delicious.  Street corn, tacos and guacamole are my favorites.  Have a healthy happy making salad too!

H0yXt5AowebDrVPxgGqufg.text: My husband and I initially had our mind set for sushi at Sushiholic tonight, but it was a long wait to be seated so we decided to try the new taco spot next door. This place was really amazing. My husband loved it too. The chef even came out at the end and spoke to us for at least 10 minutes. They prepare all foods from scratch in the house. Starting from the presentation to the flavors of the tacos It blew me away. We had Porkbelly, Korean chicken, Ahi tuna, and crunchy beef. All of them was flavorful and delicious! I can't wait to go back to try the other ones. I highly recommend this place, a can't miss for the Arcadia food scene.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna, Korean fried chicken and crunchy beef.

QOdzLudnMby3-9dgVKkFxA.text: Absolutely fantastic experience. Food = amazing.  Had Pork Belly, Crunchy Beef, Duck Breast, and Wagyu Tacos.  Would have gone through the whole menu if I had time and room! The Chicharron and House-made Michelada were a wonderful start to all of this, as recommended by Jason.  He was extremely knowledgeable about all of his ingredients and menu items.  Was also able to meet Chef Rich and his crew in the back of the house...great team! Finished off with The Pisco Kid Cocktail...very refreshing and would have loved another, but ran out of time.  Comfortable bar stools, and clean restroom as well!  Can't wait to go back!  Well done CRUjiente....well done.

InQJBN7VnC5yP3MDDS7bLg.text: I'm lucky to have this place in my neighborhood, although I'd happily drive any distance for what I consider the best tacos and margaritas in the valley. The atmosphere inside is unexpectedly hip and warm, a True gem hidden within a commercial complex. The weekly deals are a steal for incredibly top notch food, and the servers are knowledgeable and friendly. Lauren recognized me my 2nd time in, and welcomed me back like an old friend. Be sure to ask for the "secret" dessert, a family recipe from the chef - you'll be glad you did!

hxWZ49rHM6gAT8Kx7QP7dw.text: Kind of expensive for tacos but very yummy and excellent service. Atmosphere was amazing so I guess it is worth it!

YKgGHvvqUgo1W8Sx9qsfOA.text: Tuesday Night Supper Club   We had a group of 20 this time, and the servers were very attentive.    Started with a trio of salsas & guacamole.  Guac was very flavorful and they provided nice options of creamy green, tomatillo and a red salsa with mediocre chips.  I prefer super thin or thick like you get in Mexico.  Next course, Ahi Tuna taco with a Taro root shell, delicious sashimi grade simple dish with a few green onions on top.  Not too spicy for the tender tongues.  Three other tacos were served: Crispy pork belly, crispy beef and crispy green chile.  Not a fan of the quick kimchi on top of the pork belly, meat was very tasty.  The beef taco was my favorite, flavorful and the right amount of toppings.  Green chile my least favorite - not spicy enough, strange flavor. My friends and family loved the green chile taco, so it's a matter of taste.  Biggest blunder by the restaurant was they did not provide complimentary 'extra' salsa for the tacos.  I realize the chef has a certain flavor they are looking to achieve, yet for the patrons who are accustom to eating out regularly a side of salsa is a given at a taco joint.  Overall a four given the tasty dishes - know that these tacos are pricey ($5-6 per) so it's not your roadside taco stand!

zaSPmqa-grJLkiB1LUn01A.text: Great bar/cocktails, great atmosphere, great service but the food eclipsed them all.  Each time I tried a different taco, it became my immediate favorite.  The flavor combos are so good, one could simply order randomly from the menu and come away completely satisfied and wanting more. Bravo!!

_h5Hi0-QeFIz_t4w5tevSw.text: Omg! This place is amazing! Tacos so special and unique. You just don't find these kind of joints everyday! We ordered the taco of the week which was simple but somehow so good out of he most basic of ingredients! Chicharrones and refried beans, aji tuna tacos, and pork belly! Just delicious! Margarita is anejo tequila and lovely

OpE7ZXOP0UF9ztqCyYc3rA.text: The service was fantastic, we met Noor tonight and she was very attentive and friendly.  We ordered Aguachile to start followed by Posole Rojo and a few tacos both crujiente and de la calle with some drinks. It was tough to decide what to order as everything on the menu looked delicious. The flavor and presentation were great. We will pay a premium for good food but the portions and price seemed disproportionate for the atmosphere. Corn tortilla flavor could be better and more "authentic" to match the menu.

FHNCMn1YBTut6326xvC1LQ.text: Don't let the strip mall location fool you, Cru offers some serious eats.  The setting was very well appointed and the drinks were great.  The fresh and hot cocktail was my favorite (can't go wrong with gin and elderflower).  We went for happy hour and tried the pork belly and Korean fried chicken, as well as the taco of the week.  Pork belly was the best, Korean fried chicken was great but very very spicy.  Taco of the week was an Indian take on a taco and missed the mark, too salty and seasonings overpowered everything.  Pork belly and Korean chicken were a tad over salted as well but quite good.  I'd recommend going for happy hour, too pricey and tacos too small to make a full on meal.  Will go back, service was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh and hot cocktail and cru margarita
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco de la seamana (on the right) &amp; kimchi pork belly taco ($1 off from 3-6pm)

HFjSGOuflv8dFI0hBcRTrQ.text: Came into CRUjiente tonight during happy hour. They have all night happy hour on Wednesday's so that is pretty cool. My wife and I started with the chips and salsa trio. The salsas were all really flavorful and the chips were nice and crispy. Our server actually ended up bringing out more chips for us since we still had some salsa left. Between my wife and I we tried the Korean fried chicken taco, the beef short rib taco, the pork belly taco, and lastly the crunchy beef taco. Overall, every taco had its own unique flavor. Pork belly was interesting how it was cut into small pieces but it is definitely in the fatty side. My top two were the short rib and the chicken taco. Short rib was super tender and had a good flavor and Korean fried chicken was probably the most unique. It had a very strong ginger flavor and the sauce was really good too. The shredded beef was seasoned really well in the crunchy taco. I will say that the main downfall about this place is the price in comparison to their portions. If you come and visit here I would highly recommend coming on happy hour so you can get more of a value. Tacos are really small and the price is a little high. However, you can tell that they are using quality ingredients so I didn't mind that much. Lastly, I got their happy hour margarita for $5 and that was a really good deal. Pretty strong marg for 5 bucks. Come check this place out for happy hour!

ky1qThc-uPkkU4uLKgIOtQ.text: This is an interesting place which tries to be innovative with their tacos. I don't love all of their food as not all tacos I have had here were consistently impressive. But they are surely on the path as I do not know any other place here in the Valley which tries to go beyond regular tacos to create something that is fun and different. I hope to find more if these gems. To be fair what I appreciate about this lil taco place is they have dared to be different, hence the one extra star  I have tried most of their tacos and I think I love their ahi poke taco served in taro chip the best. I think the crunch of the chip balances the lovely textures of the poke.   I wish them luck and hope to see more places that bring innovative offerings to the Valley.  Hopefully they keep innovating as at some point I would love to see them bumped to a 5 star. If only they are more consistent.

fL6G_hVpVPsdclFtzGBZ3g.text: Great food! We really enjoyed the crunchy tacos and the taco of the week.  The chips and salsa were amazing as well.  The salsas were flavorful and the chips served nice and warm.  Overall great food and we'll definitely be coming back.

Ks62b1GwabeRB3Z2lcx2lA.text: Awesome happy hour. Great margaritas. All the Crujente tacos we had were amazing and the habanero and tomatillo salsa are killer. Great happy hour specials too! Taco Tuesday staple from now on. Morgan was a great server for our first experience! Answered all questions, great at giving us a tour of the menu. She's a rock star!

5MK4qIcgXxooCzwkyiufrg.text: New favorite taco place. Wow. Try the wagyu beef. Or the crunchy. Or the pork belly. Need I go on?

OMI0E1H1W2qYQ0hokKbiKA.text: Located inconspicuously in a shopping center that was once anchored by Fresh and Easy. The space is intimate, modern and has a semi open kitchen. We tried several items on the menu- Korean fried chicken taco, pork belly taco, fresh guacamole and chips, beef crujiente, margaritas, and beef short rib tacos. EVERYTHING was excellent- bursting with unparalleled flavored and meticulously placed on your plate. Chef Hinojosa is well know in the valley and can be seen in the kitchen creating your dish. Jason, the owner, walks the dining room making sure everything is perfect. Try out these street tacos with a twist! You won't be sorry! I have been craving that Korean fried chicken taco ever since!

LJM5QqjW3I45vjXc1SgOYw.text: Best margaritas! Muddled orange makes them the so yummy. Tacos were pretty good, very unique options. I had avocado tempura and a lamb taco both were delicious. The service was outstanding, the red headed bartender rocks!!

RqjxTv__6RrgqIty8GXkyA.text: Came in tonight and made it in time for happy hour. Our awesome waitress let us know we had a few minutes to order. The Cru margarita is just like I like it, not to sweet. Then we had the guacamole, delicious. Husband got the shrimp street taco, 36 hour short rib street taco and the lamb crunchy taco. I got the crunchy pork. Guys, the crunchy pork is sooooo good and melts in your mouth like the most amazing pork flavored potato chip you've ever had. Order that. Do it. Server said the beef crunchy is just as good. We'll do that next time. Great service too. This is a great neighborhood restaurant. Will definitely come back. Thank you to our great sever, Danielle! Compliments to the chefs as well!

J7Qx36742aIEUwGEmyW_0Q.text: CRUjiente Tacos has been open about 6 months, and this was our first visit. We will definitely be back! Their tacos are creative and some of the tastiest we've had. They have 2 sizes: 6 inch crispy and 4 1/2 inch soft. Our server carefully explained the menu, so we knew how to order. We started with a very fresh ceviche servicer with thin crisp chips. Next, we had beef and pork 6 in crispy tacos, short rib, Korean barbecue chicken, and fish tacos all of the smaller size. Although our favorite was the Korean chicken, all were very good. They have a decent selection of wine, beer, tequila, and mixed drinks. Happy hour prices are 3-6 pm, later on weekends, and all evening on Wednesday. Prices are fair for the quality, and happy hour will save you some $, too. Give this place a try!

34YwgSkq52Jz6HLbJFzvCQ.text: This place is amazing! I recommend this spot to anyone that lives in the area. I go at least twice a month to satisfy my taco and margarita craving. The tacos are delicious. I've tried most of them and never get tired of this place. They have a Taco of the Week, that's off menu and only available for that week, and they've always been so good. The specialty margaritas are so freaking good I crave them!   It's not a big place and they have limited hours so definitely take advantage of the Yelp waitlist before you arrive. Also, parking is limited so carpool or catch a ride share.   Full bar (I've enjoyed some great beers here) yummy apps, great place to meet friends, bring out of town guests and have a fun night.   100% recommend. I've always had amazing service.

x-vQfNtU9qqL834C5YIuqg.text: This has been on my list for months !! Excited to finally check it out and was lucky enough to show up on Thirsty Thursday - $2 dollars off all margs, cocktails and wine.   Loved the margarita options the Arcadia had a great jalapeno kick.   Service was fast and attentive.   The space is fairly small with an open kitchen and some community tables.  Everything is made from scratch. As a vegetarian I found plenty of options but was slightly disappointed by the tempura avocado which I was so eager to try.  The mushroom taco was much more flavorful and unique in my opinion.  Nothing knocked my socks off but this was a fun, casual place to go with friends. Would certainly go back.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom and tempura avocado tacos
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thirsty Thursday !

BWaIFR87VgxHJBibeUgiLw.text: Behold some of the most delicious AND most expensive tacos you'll ever have in an average environment with ok service... some of these were some of the best tacos I've had so far, and definitely the most outrageously expensive ones too.   They serve gourmet tacos, carefully prepared with premium ingredients that taste really really good, freshly made tortillas too...my only issue is to pay $6.50 for a taco that after tax and gratuity ends up $9! For a single 3in diameter taco?! See pics  So we had 4 tacos each plus one beer and paid over $110 with tip...yes you saw that just fine, our bill was over $110 buckaroos for 8 gourmet tacos and 2 beers, I'm still confused about how this happened although they were delicious...I'm giving 4 stars only because of their super high prices...

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef &amp; Lamb tacos on top, order these if your hungry as they&#39;re the biggest ones
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; Fish taco on a 3in diameter tortilla
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wagyu taco that is to die for! Also $9 after tax and tip. Ask for an extra tortilla .25c to make it last longer

ZxlLWM5ngQusg-D2SXvztA.text: The best fusion tacos in town, just sat on the bar and asked the bartender for recommendations and everything was delicious!! Atmosphere is good, drinks are  amazing...I'm a happy customer.

nsB4trl-Bh1e2fd8ufQGdw.text: Not gonna lie, I was really hungry when I came here at 3:30pm on a Friday afternoon.   We ordered some tacos, the Tempura Avocado Taco, the Fresh Fish Taco, the Shrimp Taco and the Mushroom Taco ($1 off during HH)  We really enjoyed these tacos!! The tortillas we're soft, didn't fall apart and super tasty!   Nice big booths to sit in and our server was pretty attentive, which is great when I have a gluten allergy! She was able to help navigate the menu and select items I could have without too many modifications.    10/10 recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bag of chips. Not gluten free, deep fried in same fryer as other breaded/ battered food. But I heard they were tasty!
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Many awards and accolades, great job!
Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Super tasty, wish there was a little more of a serving.

HDq_VXfTrMAZB6nX_CFkgA.text: Excellent artisan tacos.  This is the gourmet stuff. Melt in your mouth, delicate, balanced...   Strong drinks,  crunchy tacos.  Quality stuff.    Came straight from the airport.  Happy hour (3-6 pm)- woohoo!   $7 passion fruit margarita.  Wish it had a little bit more passion fruit flavor.  Nice balance of sweet, salty, spicy though.    $5 Garlic roasted mushroom taco was spot on. Lovely roasted gourmet mushrooms.  Garlic wasn't overwhelming,  but a nice balance of flavors and textures.  Definitely on the filling side.   $4 Korean fried chicken taco was tasty and pretty.   $4.50 crunchy pork taco wasn't too fatty,  but rich and delicious,  contrasted by the crunchy,  spicy,  savory cabbage slaw.  Excellent balance and probably my fav.   Little gnat kept flying around my plate, which was little annoying.    This is a hangout place to chill,  not if you're super hungry,  but want gourmet tacos in a cool environment.    Great little spot!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crunchy pork taco $4.50 during happy hour

Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

Fs935KXKUNOTyYKgYIPj9g.text: It started off a bit rocky. They respond quickly to yelp messages, but reservations are available only for parties of 5 or larger. The location is not the most romantic, being inside a small mall and next to CVS. They were out of Cazadores Blanco and Don Julio. And we almost missed happy hour. But then... it got better, a LOT better.  Our waitress recommended a tequila for our margaritas that was divine. One of the tastiest I've had. They have a larger selection of whiskys than other places we visited, and it seems they are working to expand their library of alcoholic beverages.   The staff worked together and helped us get our orders right before happy hour closed. All the tacos were creative and delicious. My friend and I split each taco so we could try as many as possible. These aren't the huge monsters you get at fast food places, but closer to the palm of my hand. They are filling though.  Highly recommend the green hot sauce. If you can handle the heat, you will absolutely love it. I wish I could take a bottle home with me. They take great efforts to elevate their food. For example, they bring the chips in bags rather than on plates so they stay crisp and warm. The noise level is decent. The interior is nice, and the designs inside the ceiling lamps are quite cool.  Jason, the co-owner, was extremely friendly and informative.  This is a joint for locals, unlike some of the newer establishments that seem a bit too touristy. Definitely coming back!

2aw2zo1exbo5yrESPAeGqA.text: I always passed by CRUjiente Tacos but never made it in.  Well now, I finally have eaten here and the food and drinks are delicious! The bar is long and the drinks are fancy but wonderful.   We started with the Salsa Trio, and everything about this antojito was perfection. The fresh tortilla chips are served in a paper bag, and served hot. This is served with 3 salsas, verde, pasilla, habanero (hot).  After eating these chips, I was not too hungry so I ordered two tacos - one crujiente and one taco de la calle. I decided to go with the Beef Crujiente with Cheddar-jack, cabbage, house hot sauce, pico de gallo  which was OK to me, I didn't feel like there was anything special about it.  For the Tacos de la Calle, I tried the Fresh Fish with citrus slaw and ancho tartar which I really liked.  The next time I revisit, I am going to try a specialty cocktail and some other tacos.  A lot of reviews I read, pork belly seems to be the favorite, so I might try that next!

7WSdoVH0rQ1Mfdbekmx5uQ.text: Wow !! This is our neighborhood spot. We were fortunate enough to come here for a friends birthday and this place didn't disappoint. Cool atmosphere inside, very friendly staff, and most important the food and beverages were out of this world. My husband and I now make this our weekly routine for Monday margaritas and tacos ! I was never really a taco fan, but this has definitely opened up my taste buds to a new world. The coconut margarita and pork belly tacos are a must !

dKsOOxPotPofcqUbBsCj9A.text: At the Taco Festival everyone speaks so highly of this place so I finally decided to ask one of my dates do take me! They looked so aesthetically pleasing I couldn't resist. I'd recommend making a reservation ahead of time. We went on a Thursday at like 7 and it was still packed our wait was short but if you're impatient; that's the way to go. I got the passion fruit margarita without the Serranos and my date got the strawberry one without the habaneros (spicy alcohol is so weird to me) they both were strong but I liked his a bit more.   The tacos didn't disappoint. I got the Korean fried chicken, Texas Wagyu steak, and the special Korean short rib. It was such a nice, bougie switch up from my regular street tacos, I loved it! They even have dessert tacos which I'll have to come back and try hoping I like the speciality.   Date Rating: 2 out of 5. Tunde is like straight from Nigeria. Or so that's what he told me. He calls me a "socialite" but that's because he doesn't ever leave the area code of Tempe lol (I can't imagine why a grown man would refuse to venture away from a bunch of college kids but I digress) in his whole two years of living in the states so far he's never been anywhere else but a couple clubs in Old Town. How incredibly boring that you don't wanna explore your environment.  You know those kids you graduate with in high school that wanna become rappers and chase that dream well into their 20s? Well my dear friend Tunde is like that but wants to be a professional athlete. I'm a sucker for seeing people get all excited about what they love to do so it was kinda sweet seeing the stars in his eyes. I'm hoping that works out. When he made a comment about Chris Brown being on Beyonce's level in terms of performing, AFTER watching Homecoming; I knew I wouldn't be able to take him seriously.  And then we watched me eat while he didn't touch his food. All of these little things would not allow me to imagine this going further romantically. He was attractive and we laughed but it all just felt too buddy buddy. Or maybe it was because he wanted me to order for him and then I felt like his big sister. He apparently gets tables out in Old Town so I will be making an appearance and putting my friends on to all his friends. Someone around here deserves to get lucky after all my effort.

oEWH23AfuIdkr8EQeooVig.text: Not too sure what to think about them their happy hour specials pretty good the tacos are pretty decent but I'm not really a fancy Taco Guy I'm more of a food truck Taco Guy give me some good asada or lingua are Cabeza and I'm super happy maybe throw a beer in there but this ain't that place well the beer definitely but for a different kind of Taco pretty good the mushroom when was my favorite and the fried chicken that's pretty good too our server was great very attentive was able to ask all my questions even brought some extra salsa definitely go back if want something different

mLg4IGu7T8iNyGq2xdfRXA.text: Second time I've been, and will continue to travel from North Phoenix (NoPho) to have the BEST tacos and margaritas! So appreciative of my Grandpa who turned me onto this place via watching a PBS show, of all things. Such a little gem in the city!!

tR2d6fSpVQoEBtRAlZ-Syg.text: Amazing cocktails and delicious food! We were planning to get sushi next door but then we got side tracked with this place...and wow, it was da bomb!! Definitely worth the trip! You would never think a good place like this would be in a basic strip mall like this but it is and it's awesome! Our server was Nicole was super friendly and helpful..told us about all the yummy recommendations and she was right on point and got it just right because everything she recommended was ! Will definitely come back!

lCiKbVB5zo1QOSHxLuFTjw.text: Delicious!! Chef Richard Hinojosa elevates tacos to a whole different level-these are definitely not your ordinary tacos.  The combinations and flavors are outstanding & the ingredients are top quality.  I had the Tempura Avocado Taco & 36 Hour Beef Short Rib Taco.  Both were amazing. I love beef short ribs and this was the most tender and flavorful I've ever had. Yes, they're small-just 3 bites, but well worth it. If you're going for dinner, you'll want to order 3-4, and maybe an appetizer.   Would have had more but we had just come from a pre-wedding party and had eaten quite a fews apps before. Next time we'll come hungry.

idaPU7sdwux-jUby_l4gwQ.text: Best Margarita in the valley our waitress says....omg, on the money! I gave her my sideways, "right, I've heard that before look," but, heck yeah! It truly is! It's the CRU Margarita, please for the love of all tequila lovers, order this! We're here on a Wednesday, which is all day happy hour. Our CRU Margarita is only $5, reg. Priced at $10 Let me tell you, there's no skipping on the pour here, it's Devine! The salsa trio, guacamole to die for, and ahi poke tacos, all amazing!  I always say you can tell a Mexican restaurant by the chips and salsa, these chips come out in a brown paper sack, thin, crispy, salty perfection! This place is fairly small, but the atmosphere is great, music, bar feel, with cool decor.  Winner, winner, I'll be back!

NnVPoId8oZCL8TlPADIbbQ.text: One of my favorite taco spots! Great happy hour as well! Very trendy spot, parking is hard, would recommend ubering if possible. The service is much better at the bar than the with the wait staff! Food is 5 stars, service is lacking a bit!

hu3N_fr2sCT6bvsOL_ku9A.text: Get ready for some awesome, upscale tacos. I came for Taco Tuesday since they have some pretty good deals on their tacos, and I ordered a Cru Paloma cocktail (it was ok) plus 3 tacos: pork belly (which was basically carnitas), beef short rib, and Korean fried chicken. I liked the Korean fried chicken one the best. It was crispy, fried-chickeny goodness with an amazing sauce. Second place goes to beef short rib, and third goes to pork belly (because it was good but not that different from a regular carnitas taco).   Finally, I got a dessert taco, which changes seasonally. Today's version was butter-fried carrot cake with a sweet goat cheese drizzle and pecans. It was amazing! I highly recommend it.

dhfbugWvw7vmuvz0686Fgw.text: Small cozy spor for tacos with a modern twist. Came here with friends some time back. There are plenty of comfortable booths and hight chair tables to sit at. We were seated promptly and started with the queso....then ordered another round of queso because it was that yummy. I had the premium margarita and it was on point  I got the duck, pork belly and korean fried chicken tacos. Each one of them was presented beautifully and tasted delicious. I like that they have many choices and interesting flavors. A bit on the pricey side but they are fancy delicious tacos!

HVYu6UOvv5exW5BG7T21gQ.text: They had me at lamb tacos. Once again, Yelp totally did me right by featuring this online. Whoop whoop. These are fan-friggin-tastic tacos! I"ve been twice in two weeks. (can I get a frequent diner discount?) My absolute go to is and will be the lamb taco. Lamb is my favorite thing to eat in.the.world. SErved in a hard shell it's a great twist on the typical soft shell street tacos. The short rib and wagyu are my absolute favorites as well. Be sure to order the chorizo dip appetizer. Sweet baby Jesus it's delicious. The Happy Hour is great. Discounts on a variety of apps and tacos as well as drinks.

wr0LfHAKJjJyRzTx3LJkmw.text: The best tacos in Arizona. Try the crunchy pork tacos! Their queso is also to die for!

w65SCZglVcudsEHhshjhIg.text: I'm never on Yelp. I rarely leave positive ratings about anything. These are easily the best tacos I've ever had. If you don't agree, then I don't know what to tell you. The end.

0dPxyfVPUY-drh-DsNxSzA.text: Definitely my new favorite Taco spot!! The food is phenomenal and I loved the aesthetic of the bar.

AvwpvWfMyC6d9IxH0GiK5g.text: Now this is how tacos should taste!  Gourmet, delicious and great drink selection. Try the pork belly tacos. OMG. You won't regret it.

11INLTd6K0_iwhoS6khCjA.text: I eat at CRUjiente's probably once a month. Even after having tried some of the other taco locations, this is the place I keep coming back to over and over. Pros: The crunchy tacos are not to be missed! Best chips in town (always served hot in a brown paper bag). Creative and delicious weekly tacos (I'm not vegetarian, yet some of their veggie special tacos have blown me away)! Great cocktails (the Japanese Bees and the Premier CRU margaritas are my favorite). Cons: A bit on the pricey side, and lot parking can be limited in busy nights.

ktbgnr2pPDesfY2sB1_cfQ.text: Amazing food and drinks.  Excellent service.  Great ambiance.  You won't be disappointed.

GzkPp-h5r9w72MqaIOmx5A.text: They serve what is clearly the product of a passionate foodie owner! Amazing care and flavor with each dish, friendly and attentive staff, and you have to try the HH!!!!

Lenhm-R_QGMf6mZkHY7RaQ.text: We stopped here on a whim after eating at another disappointing taco joint. Wow the tacos here are on another level. Not your traditional tacos, it's more like a Tex-mex Korean American fusion taco. So delicious and I'm Hispanic! I will be going back for sure!

H6hiJuS08aYrbx2gENiB7w.text: We came with a large group (20 people) and the place was a little smaller than expected but service was great and the tacos were well worth the trip! Because we were a large group we contacted restaurant first and got great recommendation to place a pre-order which made the night run much more smoothly. Personal favorites were the pork belly tacos and the Korean fried chicken tacos, but really they were all tasty.  Everyone was pleased with the margaritas as well, nice variety and they came with a good amount of liquor which we all appreciated!

hw0QyzZ75o0d9LG1tdQEww.text: Truly a gem in Phoenix. I almost don't want to write a review to prevent this place from getting more noticed and crowded but that's just me being selfish.  We started with ceviche and posole rojo, which is a great meat stew and it is perfect for the recent cold weather. They were amazing but what really hit home run for us were the tacos and their drinks. We tried both tacos crujientes (crunchy tacos) and tacos de la calle (street tacos).   Beef tacos cruijentes - a solid hard shell taco packed with meat, fresh veggies and a little bit of kick.  Pork belly - juicy and flavorful. the kimchi topping, which is not your typical red kimchi but more like a pickled white cabbage, is a great touch.  Blue crab - a great solid crab taco. I love the avocado mousse they use on this taco. it was my friend's favorite. 36 hour braised beef short rib - super soft and lot of flavors this one! My husbands favorite but must warn you, it is spicy! korean fried chicken - I didn't order this one mostly because I'm korean and was afraid that my love for korean fried chicken would make me a harsh food critic. But my friend who's tried it said it was amazing. I'll have to give it a try next time.  As for drinks, they have an amazing drink selection - beer, wine, spirits.. you name it. I don't remember the names of all of them but we each had at least 3 cocktails because they were delicious. Also got to try the best mezcal I've had so far per the owner's recommendation - Crema de Mezcal. Lightly sweet and very smooth.   To top it off, everyone at the restaurant was very attentive and provided top-notch service. I recently moved out here from LA and my husband and I've been looking for our go-to spot. This place might be it for us. Service, food, vibe - Crujiente Tacos has it all.

ympka6s3abN7Yia_8zm7ZQ.text: I said that I would try every single Taco on their menu. So today I tryed three new tacos and of cores there famous pork belly taco "amazing". First up was the duck Taco that had sweet taste of mole sause, sesame with a hint of peanut and a tab bit of verdant salsa, the duck was so tender and full of savory flavor. The 2nd Taco was the ahi poke. It had seaweed, green onion, kawasaki and sweet taste of taro root. Then I tryed there Taco of the week. It has white bean octopus and chorizo. I have never tryed some thing here and not enjoyed it. The pork belly I would say is still my favorite but the duck and octopus are right behind it. If you come you have to try these three tacos. Their staff is always friendly and very knowledgeable about there menue. Thank you agen for the amazing experience.

Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly taco. Amazing

WFHRTwSB5bL0N2Vt_YQ3Vw.text: The moment you walk into this place the decor is outstanding!!! Such beautiful design. Went in with a few co-workers for happy hour. The margarita is real!!! Tastes real good, strong, and made from scratch. For apps ordered the guac and salsa trio, which were fantastic but I thought was too expensive when you can get similar salsa for free at other places.   What did turn me off was brown paper bag for chips. Wtf, I paid $6 for chips and salsa and you can't give me a plate? That's not creative, that's lazy.   The street tacos are so well thought out! It's Mexican classics with Asian influence. I ordered the following tacos: Korean fried chicken, shredded beef crunchy, and avocado tempura. The best one was the crunchy beef, hands down! Everyone else also really enjoyed their tacos.   The waitress informed us that in 2 weeks they will begin margarita Monday's so will have to most certainly come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy tacos and weird brown bag for chips.

VYyzDc_sMoWs6FhjfCXFBQ.text: Tonight was my first visit to CRU and overall I enjoyed. Our waitress was great very friendly and she was on point so good service is always a plus. The handmade margaritas for $5 is the best ever. Definitely the best hh margarita I have had in a long time so I would frequent this spot for those alone. I tried the Korean chicken taco which was different, interesting and yummy. It's fried so probably not your healthiest taco but yummy and it's a street taco size so you don't have to feel too bad. My cousin tried the lamb taco which she didn't like but supposedly they are a fav so maybe try it for your self. I also ordered a quesadilla with chicken. It was not  the best. It was nice and crispy but it was gobs of cheese and even for a cheese lover you want more chicken than cheese which it was not. It was a kids and it was $10 so please more chicken than cheese. I would definitely come again but I would stick to the yummy CRU margaritas and the Korean chicken tacos and I would be a happy camper.

bB0aYqR9iuHKwRQ47u9ktw.text: I was excited at first because it was $5 margarita Monday. The margarita was good but that's really it. They charge you $6 for chips/salsa and $5 for tiny tacos. I was still hungry with a $30 bill when I left.

GsrRhCh090pjk-UeHb6MWg.text: Hands down amazing food! I have never had a bad taco here, in fact, they are some of the best tacos I have ever had. The chorizo queso and salsa trio are great for starters. The owners are around most of the time and are extremely friendly!! Little known fact- the owner is quite the wineo, and if you are as well you should take a couple extra minutes to talk to him and to try his favorite!

6fxPsd8cf__v2Jhuxq_OdA.text: So so good. I was really impressed with the place. The tacos were phenomenal. The drinks were also very good. The place was dark and cool. The chicken taco and braised how many hours pork was so good. I'll for sure be back.

UzBANzh3N41J0PS-wUJZvQ.text: First, it's beautiful inside! Second, menu was unique in an amazing way. I had the Korean fried taco, blue crab taco and their AMAZING ahi poke taco. All were more than great. The Ahi was my favorite, I even asked the owner Jason if I could buy from the chef.   Will most definitely be back

10g772NSvZ6qAF-wzXx0wg.text: Do you love crazy-delicious tacos for $5?  Think crab, duck, 36-hour beef short rib.  It's True!  Do you love world-class wine by the glass?  It's a romantic sports bar (I'm not kidding, this is possible) and they pulled all of this together in Arcadia at CRUjiente.  Big fat yum!

l7BfLY6hojOMaGqPQ7KG9g.text: Each taco was made with great care.  Crispy lamb (crujiente) is a velvety love song with a crunch in my mouth.  Korean Fried Chicken is a meticulously constructed Asian/Latin/crunchy buffalo wing kind of fusion I'll go back for again and again. Respectable beverage program with accessible prices too. Both owners are on site, all the time. It's a winner. Welcome to the neighborhood.

EhM3N3uPkLyyuZX_igAOwQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped by after work for a bite to eat. We both ordered cocktails to start. Definitely try the Fresh and Hot! Hendricks gin and elderflower, with a dash of cayenne pepper for heat. We also ordered the beef short rib taco, ahi poke, and the pork belly. The beef short rib melted like butter in my mouth. The staff is amazing and very attentive. If you get a chance, definitely splurge on some Yamazaki 12 year single malt Japanese whiskey on the rocks. Very smooth. Just an all around great place. Welcome to the neighborhood Crujiente!!!

I3go0mgGjpBcOAtxt41yxQ.text: I honestly can't believe how much I loved this place! A friend recommended this restaurant and tonight we finally stopped in! It's a neat setup with plenty of seating for being a seemingly small space. We came on Tuesday so many of the tacos were discounted all night for taco Tuesday! We missed the happy hour cutoff, but ordered their house margarita anyway and it was worth the couple extra bucks! The margarita was simple, but so delicious-you can tell it's made with high quality ingredients. We started off with the salsa trio  & chips which was great. Between my husband, friend & myself we tried one of each of the taco CRUjientes (beef, lamb & pork) which were all delicious. Simple but well seasoned. We also had the Texas Wagyu Cap Steak, Pork Belly, Korean Fried Chicken & the 36 Hour Beef Short Rib. They were all delicious & put together so well! My favorite was the pork belly, but my husband raved about the wagyu steak. Jason, one of the owners stopped by the table and you can just really tell he is passionate about the place they've created. They don't just put any old toppings on a taco, they really do take the time & energy to craft their menu, tacos & drinks. We will definitely be back & can't wait to try their taco or the week!

-uirFOTsBEvPLr4aRmjGCw.text: Perfection! We LOVED CRU and can't wait to come back. So flavorful, balanced and we were already making plans on the calendar to come back before we were even done with our meal!  We went during Happy Hour (6 Days a week fri n sat too) and I highly recommend if you like trying different foods/flavors- your wallet will like you too! But really anytime works best for me, because it's worth every bite!  From the margaritas, ceviche, Mexican Caesar salad w roasted poblano dressing and ALL the tacos (although we didn't try the taco of the week - sweet potato), we did have every other taco on the menu (and except the tempura avocado and any of the CRUjientes tacos). Each and every bite was phenomenal. The pork belly, short rib and ahi poke stood out, if that's even possible, because just Yum on each and every flavor so different from the other!   As to all the people who wrote comments about size and price - you definitely get your money's worth here! And for the people who write about Bien Trucha or El Toda Madre (40 Miles outside of Chicago) there is NO comparison. Between the textures and differentiating flavors - there's Nothing we've found yet that even comes close to CRUjentes.   If you are a foodie and looking for a genuinely culinary experience, great service, clean and hip atmosphere and at a great price - mark your calendars today!

qO1_3LXC2skCNIjdtesl3g.text: Wow!  Really kicking myself for not trying this spot out sooner.  Had quite the sampling of food and drink and was pretty blown away start to finish.  Our server was very helpful and attentive.  She recommended doing both the hard and soft shell tacos, which is absolutely the way to do it.  I'm really hard pressed to pick a favorite between the lamb, fish, and shrimp tacos.   The guacamole was very flavorful and the corn appetizer was an unexpected score.  Cocktails were well balanced and delicious (their version of a Cadillac marg was fantastic).  The only constructive criticism I would have is that the hi def TVs at the bar should be larger given the distance from the seats.  Can't wait to come back here. Food: ***** Ambiance: **** Service: **** Value: *****

aQe2fR0GP92Jpk_mGz8yvA.text: The atmosphere at this place is incredible. We sat at the bar and had a great time. Everything was good, but I think the only thing that was great was the Korean taco.   Queso: 3 Stars Deluxe Margarita: 3 stars Shrimp Taco: 4 stars Short Rib Taco: 3 Stars Korean Taco: 5 Stars

BshegXCt36mfQoPbvy80Jg.text: I had high hopes for this place, unfortunately it was just ok (but service was excellent!).  I like that they have a reverse happy hour on a Friday.  Great deals on Tecate during that time ($2.50 or $3).   We tried 4 different tacos and they all sounded so good, but were underwhelming.  We had the pork belly, Korean fried chicken, fish and short rib tacos.  The short rib was a bit tough.   My husband usually loves Korean fried chicken, but took one bite of this one and wouldn't eat any more.  Of the 4, I thought that one was the best.  We also had the salsa trio, which also was just OK.   Overall, nothing spectacular, but worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of CRUjiente Tacos - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_UNOSxb3p92mOaFkChshvA.text: No hostess. Poor service. Bartender did not know how to pour beer. When the waitress brought the beer, it was over half foam. She instructed me to wait until the bubbles were near the top and then drink it. (I know how to drink beer, tell your bartender to learn how to pour it). Waited about 15 minutes for the bubbles to settle and was still about one third foam and not even a full glass. Ordered 4 tacos. 2 were good (avocado taco is great, and duck confit was good but bland for having a habanero reduction) 2 were bad- goat taco was dry and bland, pork belly taco tasted like fish. (Wtf?) while food was decent, would definitely not go here again. Overpriced, poor service.

Im-qBAnLH-1Ueu-4BDHfog.text: Boom!  If you live gourmet tacos (as I do) and fresh margaritas (as I do) this is your place.  Food was on point, guacamole had perfect blend of spice.  Great experience all around and we will be back!

pwr7tXIRjqCQT4vzNf9GNg.text: This place is a diamond in the rough. The food is top notch. It's become my new favorite place to hit up. Make sure you come in during the week after 3 PM and have Laura at the bar mix you up some of the best cocktails in Phoenix. If you don't know what to pick out on the menu, just ask Laura. Every time I've been there all of her suggestions have been outstanding.
